answers.answer: I drank raspberry leaf tea daily. Two of them. I wasn't trying to kick start labour though but it worked. I used an excerise ball to get him low and squats amd pelvic tilts. Also sex
I read online that a really strong foot massage has been known to induce labor...even if it doesn't work you will have happy feet :)
I drank ginger tea daily for nausea so in sure it's fine to drink, not sure if it'll help induce labor though!  I heard birthing balls and sex helps lol
Who says your baby will be 10 pounds? The weight they take of the baby is just an estimate

Simply try asking your doctor to induce you. With my previous pregnancy when my doctor asked if I had any complaints or questions I gave him a whole list of every ache, pain and annoyance and he agreed to put me out of my misery and induce.

Don't give that weight estimate another thought! That's just what it is....an estimate. My sister was told she was going to have a massive baby and they claimed that the ultrasounds proved that. She had gestational diabetes so they delivered at 37 weeks and a freaking squirrel popped out! I think my niece barely cleared 5 1/2 pounds. And as for me my drs, in different states BTW, each said that my kids were going to be tiny little things, maybe six pounds if I was lucky, and both my kids were 8 and a half pounds! I'm now pregnant with my third and I'm not even going to bother asking. My personal goal is for a 9 pounder though LOL. Trying to breed champions here! LOL

I just attended a birthing class that was put on by a nurse of the hospital I will be delivering at. She suggested (no joke) a glass of wine and really, really good sex to get labor going. She said the wine won't hurt the baby and the sex won't hurt either. But she said it had to be really good in order for it to work. Lol

question: Is ginger root tea ok to drink to try and get labor going at 37 weeks and 5 days.im trying to avoid a c-section because baby will be 10 pounds by his due date
title: advice on getting labor going
